lom:description.lom:string: "The following fourteen patterns form the beginning approaches to a pattern language for Computer Science course development. They might have application to other fields as well. The patterns are not all at the same level of scale. Some speak to the overall course organization and some to very low level things. The general flow is from large structure (semester courses) to small scale (daily activities). A long term goal is to develop them into a proper language." The 14 patterns described are: * Early Bird * Spiral * Consistent Metaphor * Toy Box * Tool Box * Lay of the Land * Fixer Upper * Larger Than Life * Student Design Sprint * Mistake * Test Tube * Fill in the Blanks * Gold Star * Grade it Again Sam.

lom:title.lom:string: Fourteen Pedagogical Patterns for Teaching Computer Science
